entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as having a particularly bad time of it, being surrounded by people, and being concerned for his Firebolt's safety. (Excerpt: 'He couldn’t walk to class without Slytherins sticking out their legs and trying to trip him up; Crabbe and Goyle kept popping up wherever he went...')

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: Slytherin is described as sticking out their legs and trying to trip Harry up, and putting him out of action. (Excerpt: 'He couldn’t walk to class without Slytherins sticking out their legs and trying to trip him up...')

entities.name: crabbe
entities.description: Crabbe is described as popping up wherever Harry went, looking disappointed when they saw him surrounded by people. (Excerpt: 'Crabbe and Goyle kept popping up wherever he went...')

entities.name: goyle
entities.description: Goyle is described as popping up wherever Harry went, looking disappointed when they saw him surrounded by people. (Excerpt: 'Crabbe and Goyle kept popping up wherever he went...')

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as being present in the Gryffindor common room the night before the match. (Excerpt: 'All usual pursuits were abandoned in the Gryﬀindor common room the night before the match. Even Hermione...')

entities.name: gryffindor
entities.description: Gryffindor is described as taking up the challenge enthusiastically to accompany Harry everywhere he went. (Excerpt: 'The whole of Gryﬀindor House took up the challenge enthusiastically...')

entities.name: wood
entities.description: Wood is described as giving instructions that Harry should be accompanied everywhere he went. (Excerpt: 'Wood had given instructions that Harry should be accompanied everywhere he went...')

relationships.description: Harry is targeted by Slytherins, who try to trip him up and put him out of action. (Excerpt: 'He couldn’t walk to class without Slytherins sticking out their legs and trying to trip him up...')
Harry is targeted by Crabbe, who pops up wherever Harry goes. (Excerpt: 'Crabbe and Goyle kept popping up wherever he went...')
Harry is targeted by Goyle, who pops up wherever Harry goes. (Excerpt: 'Crabbe and Goyle kept popping up wherever he went...')
Gryffindor House takes up the challenge to protect Harry and accompany him everywhere he goes. (Excerpt: 'The whole of Gryﬀindor House took up the challenge enthusiastically...')
Wood gives instructions to protect Harry and accompany him everywhere he goes. (Excerpt: 'Wood had given instructions that Harry should be accompanied everywhere he went...')
